figure_0005: Sweet syndrome in a patient with AML secondary to MDS. Erythematous-edematous papules and plaques affecting (A), face and (B), anterior region of the forearm.
figure_0010: Bullous pyoderma gangrenosum. Shallow ulcers with blue-gray borders (A) on the back and (B) on the upper limb.
figure_0015: Neutrophilic eccrine hidradenitis in a patient with AML. Erythematous-violaceous, edematous, well-defined, very painful plaques affecting (A) the dorsum of the foot and (B) the palms.
figure_0020: Eosinophilic dermatosis in patients with CLL. (A) Erythematous-edematous plaques on the back with ulceration on the upper back resulting from the act of scratching due to intense pruritus. (B) Bullous form with a lesion similar to bullous pemphigoid.
figure_0025: Paraneoplastic pemphigus. (A) Erosions on the entire labial vermilion surface. (B) Ulcerations on the upper back, similar to pemphigus vulgaris lesions.
